English: The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus.
Jinghpaw: Dai nawku htung hpe Guru Nanak (1469-1539) hku na tsaban 15th hta mu tam wa ai. Dai hpang sikt hpung sara jahku mung awng dang ai hpang bai hkan nang wa ma ai.

English: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism.
Jinghpaw: 1956 Jun shata hta, Krushchev a ga sadi ni gaw Poland hta kasu kabrawng byin ai ten tsun ai galaw ai kun ngu hpe la yu ra ai ten re wa sai. Dai lam gaw bungli galaw ai ni gaw lusha taw wa ai ten, bungli shabrai njaw ai ten, Kummyunit lailen hpe ninghkap ai de gale wa ai ten re.

English: Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
Jinghpaw: Kaning raitim, hpang jahtum hta gaw Krushchev mung arawng aya bai la na matu tank mawdaw ni sa dat ai. Sut masa hte seng ai hpyi shawn lam ni hpe jaw ya nna, mying kaba nga ai Wladyslaw Gomulka hpe mung hkringmang daju nnan hku lit ap ya na matu hkap la sai.

English: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan.
Jinghpaw: Indus Valley Civilization gaw sinna dingdung Kala dan daw chyen, ya prat na Pakistan mundan hte sinna dingdung Kala buga nkau mi hte sinpraw dingdung Afghanistan ni gaw magri prat a shinggyim gan ga ai shara ni byin lai wa sai.

English: The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name.
Jinghpaw: Indus River hka mayan kaw na rawt jat kalu kaba wa ai amyu ni kaw na dai mying hpe la da ai re.

English: Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.
Jinghpaw: Hpaji ninghkrin ni gaw ya hkraw hkrun mat sai Sarasvasti hka nu a hkam wam hkan kaw mung shinggyim hpawng nga lai wa sai majaw dai shara hpe, masha ni Harappa hpe yu nna Harappan shinggyim gan ga lai wa sai shara ngu shaga ma tim, grau na htap htuk hkra Indus-Sarasvativ masha nga pra rawt majan lai wa sai shara ngu shaga na hku tak maram yu ai raitim, 1920 ning hkan gaw shi a htingra hpe htu shaw kau ma sai.

English: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances.
Jinghpaw: Roman hkaw seng a hpyen kasat ai ladaw masa gaw tsi hpaji rawt jat wa na matu yaw shada wa ai re.

English: Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles.
Jinghpaw: Hkawseng magam Augustus gaw tsi du ni hpe lahkawn hpang nna majang ngut ai hpang matut jai lang na matu shawng na Roma Tsi Hpung hpe mung hpaw ninghtan da ai.

English: Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds.
Jinghpaw: Ga lajang tsi du ni gaw kani tum na shaw da ai morphine hte numru tsi na scopolamine ni lawm ai myit zim tsi amyu myu shapraw la ai hpaji ni hpe chye ma ai.

English: They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow.
Jinghpaw: Shanhte gaw hkum kaw na sai nhkawm ai shara ni hpe di kau na tsi ai lam ni hta grai ram wa ai ngut nna sai ni hpe lakawn ai ngut nna sai pat ai ni hpe yen nna lu hkawm hkra galaw ma ai.

English: Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.
Jinghpaw: Mungdan law law hta, Roman mungdan gaw tsi hpaji hte ya prat lang ai hpaji law law ni hta shawng hpang wa ai re.

English: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations.
Jinghpaw: Pureland origami ngu ai gaw masat da ai ripkawp ni lawm ai rai nna kapum hkang kalang sha mai lawm nna grau shuk ai kapum hkang ni gaw nmai galaw ai.

English: It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.
Jinghpaw: Dai hpe sengke jawn ai ni dai ram nau nchye jawn ai ni hpe karum na matu John Smith gaw 1970 hta gin shalat da ai re.

English: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior.
Jinghpaw: Mani gaw masha amyu ni a latat htee hkrang ni hpe kaji ai kaw na chye na ai lam grau rawt jat wa ai.

English: For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.
Jinghpaw: Lama na, myu kaji kaw na ma ni gaw jawng kaw nshakut ai gaw shanhte a myu kaji a ladat a ayang galaw ai lam hte sa bung taw ai re.

English: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently.
Jinghpaw: MySpace gaw United States kaw nambat masum mying kaba dik website re nna ya yang pi masha wan 54 lang taw ma ai.

English: These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting.
Jinghpaw: Dai website hpe masha grai ra ma ai, hpaji tam ai ni grau re.

English: There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features.
Jinghpaw: Blog, sumla hkrung, sumla hte kaga ni lawm ai hpe a loi sha mai galaw la ai internet sharin laika man zawn re ndai website ni hpe kaja ai hku mu mada ai ni ma nga ai.

English: This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling.
Jinghpaw: Dai laika man de web shara mying langai bang nna aloi sha mai shang ai, dai gaw laika nchye ka ma jawng ma ni na matu shaloi sha mai ka na hte chye matsing na matu galaw da ai re.

English: It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.
Jinghpaw: Dai hpe lu hti na matu rai ai hku mai galaw ai ngut nna hkrang law law dai nrai kachyi sha rai ai hku mai galaw ai.

English: Attention Deficit Disorder "is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy".
Jinghpaw: Attention Deficit Disorder gaw "maju lasa hte seng ai ana kumla re dai gaw du ladi re ai lam, myit maju galai ai lam hte n-gun shajan shalai re ai zawn re ana kumla ni hpe majaw byin shangun ai."

English: It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it "affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children".
Jinghpaw: Dai gaw nmai sharin ai nre, dai gaw nhti nhtang byin ai re; dai gaw ma ni hta 3 kaw na 5 percent daram byin ai re, American ma ni sen 2 daram nga na re.

English: Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation.
Jinghpaw: ADD rau re ai ma ni gaw jawng laika zawn re ai arai ni kaw myit maju jung na matu yak hkak ai aten ni nga ai rai timung shanhte gaw ginsup hpan ginsup ai lam shanhte a ra dik ai cartoon sumla hkrung ni yu ai lam ga hkring, ga sa bang ai lam n-nga ai sha ga yan ni hpe ka ai lam zawn re ai shanhte galaw pyaw dum ai arai ni hpe gaw myit maju lu jung ma ai re.

English: These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they "engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods.
Jinghpaw: Dai ma ni a bawnu gaw shawoi na ladat hku sharawng shara nnga ai kaw na, shanhte bawnu bungli galaw na matu dai ma ni gaw manghkang grai galaw wa na masa nga ai, hpa majaw nga yang shanhte gaw "hkrit ra ai arawn alai galaw hpang ai, ga law hkat ai hte up hkang salang ni hpe dangrang hkat ai".

English: ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different.
Jinghpaw: ADD gaw laga sak rum ni rau kanawn mazum ai lam hpe akyu jaw ya nga ai hpa majaw nga yang laga ma ni gaw shanhte galaw ai lam hpe hpa majaw galaw ai hpa majaw shanhte ni shachyaw ai hku laika si ni hpe shachyaw ai ngu ai lam ni hpe nlu chye na ma ai shanhte a myit kung ai lam gaw nbung ai majaw rai na re.

English: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed.
Jinghpaw: Machye machyang hkam la lu na hte galai shai ai lam hkaja lu na atsam gaw galai shai hkaja la chye ai hpaji npawt hpe lahta kaw htawng madun da sai zawn sha re.

English: The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus.
Jinghpaw: Shiga la na matu galaw ai lam gaw shai ai re. bai shaga ai hta dai kaw nga ai ni hpe myit npyaw hpa nga ai, raitim dai shaga ai laika gaw yang myit shang sha ai rai wa ai.

English: In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.
Jinghpaw: Madung tsun ga nga yang, Renaissance ngu ai Greek hpaji myit sawn ai lam gaw sharin hkaja na matu shani sa wa ai ladat hte hpaji byeng nya hpe chyam bra hkra garan kachyan ai lam hta kaba ai dandawng ai galai shai ai lam hpe galaw ya wa sai.

English: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees.
Jinghpaw: Laga masha ni zawn nre, hominids ni gaw shara htawt ai dai nrai lai ai hpe bai ai dai nrai hpun lung ai hta shanhte lata hpe nlang mat ai.

English: The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking.
Jinghpaw: Chimpanzee a lata hte lagaw ni gaw maren sha re ngut nna, lamhkawm ai ni lata galaw ai ni yawng gaw bung ai re.

English: The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges.
Jinghpaw: Shinggyim masha a lata gaw lagaw hta grau kadun ai. Lagaw nra gaw grau galu ai majaw re.

English: Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.
Jinghpaw: Shaning sen lahkang matsum daram nga ai dai nlung bum hpe htawt ai ka na manu ginsup ai de tsit wa ai hpe madun wa ai.

English: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting.
Jinghpaw: Nkau masha ni kam sham ai lam gaw masha ta hte galaw nna kaja ai zawn re hkra shamau ya ai yupmang ni law law wa hpe hkrum katut ai lam gaw grai hkyi ba shangun chye ai.

English: The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states.
Jinghpaw: Ndai mabyin masa a madung madi madun ai lam gaw REM ginra ni lapran dan leng ai yupmang ni aten nau la wa ai mahtai a majaw re.

English: With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem.
Jinghpaw: Lana mi REMs nkau mi hte rau, ndai mungdaw hta nang gaw teng sha yup pyaw ai ngu ai lam, manghkang langai byin na matu aloi hte nlu ai hpa hparan kau lu ai mahkrum madup lu mai ai.

English: This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV.
Jinghpaw: Nang yup rawt ai hte minit hkun (sh) sumshi darm TV yu ai rai yang dai lam gaw pu ba shangun ai lam re.

English: The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.
Jinghpaw: Dai akyu ara gaw na bawnu lana mi hta jahkring hkring dan dan leng leng re nna gara hku yup mang mu ai hta mahta nga ai.

English: Things did not go well for the Italians in North Africa almost from the start. Within a week of Italy's declaration of war on June 10, 1940, the British 11th Hussars had seized Fort Capuzzo in Libya.
Jinghpaw: Italy na a dingda Africa kaw bungli galaw ai nnan hta nloi ai. Shaning 1940 shata man hku 10 ya hta gasat na hpe shana ai shaloi, British ni a 11th Hussars gaw Libya kaw na Fort Capuzzo hpe dang la kau ai.

English: In an ambush east of Bardia, the British captured the Italian Tenth Army's Engineer-in-Chief, General Lastucci.
Jinghpaw: Bardia sinpraw maga kaw na makoi hkap ai shara langai hta, Itali myu sha nambat shi hpyen dap a jak ninghkring Du daju wa Lastucci hpe Inglik ni rim da ma ai.

English: On June 28, Marshal Italo Balbo, the Governor-General of Libya and apparent heir to Mussolini, was killed by friendly fire while landing in Tobruk.
Jinghpaw: Shata man hkru 28 ya hta, Libya a Munggyi Du daju, Marshal Italo Balbo hte Mussolini a hkring htawng dagraw na wa gaw Tobruk de pyenli pyen yu wa ai ten tinang hpyen dap na lak nak hte si mat wa sai.

English: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition.
Jinghpaw: Zauhkyen a prat dep ginsup hpan hpe gaw, jawng ma ni dakkasu kaw sharin la ai kaw na shabrai sha ai madang hte Olympic shingjawng poi ni kaw du hkra madang grai law ni hta ginsup nga ai re.

English: The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.
Jinghpaw: Zauhkyen ginsup ai madung gaw langai hte langai gasat shingjawng ai hpan re.

English: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes.
Jinghpaw: Gawp ginsup ai hta ginsup ai ni gaw gayat ai shingna hpe lang nna bawlung hpe hku kata de shang hkra gayat ra ai.

English: Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth.
Jinghpaw: Ginsup masha ni gaw ningshawng hku hta hpang nna ayan na hku sha shi matsat hta shangut ai hte hku shi matsat bang ginsup ai gaw ayan na shara shagu ginsup ai lam re.

English: The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins.
Jinghpaw: Kayat masat shau htum lu ai ginsup masha kalap hpung a galai shai ai lam gaw sharin hpawng hpe awng dang hkra shangut shakre na matu re.

English: The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.
Jinghpaw: Ndai game hpe tsingdu hta ginsup ai, hku grup yin na dai tsingdu pa ni hpe kadun dun re tsing shawt ai hte dai hpe atsit ngu tsun ai.

English: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism.
Jinghpaw: Mungkan buhkawng hpan law malawng gaw mash ni buhkawng ai hte seng nna ginrun dik htum ai lam ni re na re. Munkan buhkawm ai lam hpe n-nan bai galaw shapraw ai lam.

English: This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun.
Jinghpaw: Ndai ten gaw shinggyim masha ni shanhte shani shagu hkawm sa taw ai lam kaw na hkring sa (sh) ban sa la nna pyaw chyai na matu nbung ai shara de sa ma ai.

English: Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists.
Jinghpaw: Panglai hka kau ni, nampan sun ni hte dap dabang lamu ga ni gaw kalang marang ban sa ai lam hpe madun da ai mungkan hkawm sa masha ni jahkring hkring sa ai ginra re.

English: If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism.
Jinghpaw: Lama dai masha a hkawm sa ai yaw shada lam gaw labau hte htunghking hpe chye mayu ai majaw shara mi de hkawm sa ai rai yang dai hkawm sa ai lam gaw htunghking hte seng ai bu hkawm bungli magam rai nga ai.

English: Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.
Jinghpaw: Maigan bu hkawm masha ni gaw mungdan langai a nbung ai ginra shagu de sa du hkawm na re (sh) shanhte gaw dai shara langai kaw sha sa du mayu taw nga ma ai.

English: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements.
Jinghpaw: Mung maden je ai ni gaw, ndai bungli hpe yu nna hpyen lahkawn jat na matu ngu mung tsun ma ai re.

English: Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals).
Jinghpaw: Hpyen n-gun jat ai hku na Dap jum up yan re ai Yawhan Stark hte James Reed (hpang de lahkawng yan du daju tai wa ma ai) a npu na masha 200 dap dung kaba re ai Nem Hampshire 1 hte 3 lawm ai hpyen hpung ni shawng lam de rawt sa wa ma ai.

English: Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position.
Jinghpaw: Stark a hpyen la ni gaw Mung maden hpyen ni shara la da ai dingdung jahtum maga na nhpan hku shara la bang wa ma ai.

English: When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach.
Jinghpaw: Hka hpungrawt nem mat ai a majaw Mystic hka nu kaw na hpang na zundawn a sinpraw dingdung maga du hkra gang hkat mat ai aten hta shanhte gaw nhpan hpe nlung tawng hte galaw da ai shakum hte dingdung maga, panglai hka kau mayan de du hkra lawan ladan matut kau ma ai.

English: Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.
Jinghpaw: Gridley shing nrai, Stark gaw nhpan a shawng kaw pe 100 (meter 30) daram nga ai hpundung hpe tawn da nna, dinggrin hpyen dap ni n lai dingsa kadai n-gap na matu matsun ai.

English: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions.
Jinghpaw: Amerikan masing gaw nbung ai lam mahkrun masum kaw na jawm gasat ai mahkyen lu hpaw ai hta shamyet nga ai.

English: General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements.
Jinghpaw: Du daju John Cadwalder gaw hpyen n-gun jat ai lam hpe hkum pat jahkring na matu Bordentown na British maren sin dap hpe lam galai gumlang gasat na matu tsun shabra na re.

English: General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping.
Jinghpaw: Du daju James Ewing gaw mung shawa hpyen 700 hpe hka nu a kaga maga e nga ai Trenton Ferry ngu ai shara de woi awn nna, Assunpink Creek hka gai ntsa na mahkrai hpe zing la nhtawm hpyen wa a hpung ni n mai hprawng na matu shingdang na re.

English: The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.
Jinghpaw: Trenton a dingdung maga mile 9 hta nga ai hka nu hpe hpyen n-gun 2400 gaw lai wa nna uhpung lahkawng garan mat ai. Uhpung langai mi gaw Greene ningshawng ai npu hta rai nna langai mi gaw Sullivan a ningshawng ai npu kaw e rai nga ai, shanhte gaw nhtoi htoi jang gasat na matu shajin nga ai.

English: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity.
Jinghpaw: Kagat ai lam hpe deng htam mali na htam mi sha re ai kaw na deng chyen mi rai mat ai a majaw, ndai kagat ai lam hta ba lu hkam ai lam gaw chyang shadang hta grau ahkyak mat wa ai.

English: Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards.
Jinghpaw: Rai sa madang tsaw mai daw mi, minit lahkawng hte lu galaw ai masha, gaw grai lawan na re, raitim da hkam ai gaw hkrit ra ai ni yawng hpe yen kau na re.

English: Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.
Jinghpaw: Nshung ta laman hkrup ai hku lagat ai nkau mi gaw hkum hkrang lahta de na matu ginsup dum hta bai gayau ginsup ai lam gaw lagat shingjawng numdaw a matu kaja dik ai mahkyen re nga ai.

English: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness.
Jinghpaw: Htap htuk malu masha shaman shakyang ai lam ni sha gaw ningtawn ai hkrang shala ai lam hpe shabyin ya lu ai nre rai timung shanhte gaw asak kaji ai ginsup ninghkrin a guji guyang gaja na lam hpe alak mi re na akyu jaw lu ai re.

English: Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.
Jinghpaw: Hkamja ngun atsam hpe sadi ai, hkum hkrang kaw hka dat law nga matu sadia ai, ngut nna tatup galaw ni hpa atsawm sha chye na ai gaw ginsaup ai ni hpe shanhte na galaw ai lam hpe grau kaja shangu nna galaw ai bungli hpe grau manu shadan wa na re.

English: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate.
Jinghpaw: Ka-ang sumtsan wunkat manu nhpu ai hku na ginsup hpan langai re; raitim dai hta e shang lawm na matu hkinghku nkau mi shakap lang ra ai hte seng na chye na shut ai lam ni grai nga ai.

English: Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance.
Jinghpaw: Gunrai ni hpe ra ai zawn mai htet la mai ai, raitim law malawng gaw kaji mi sha re nna tatut bungli hta dai ram masan nsa ma ai.

English: Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.
Jinghpaw: Ginsup ninghkring ni gaw shahte ra yang a myet nlu jaw tim dai gunrai hpe mahtang grau ra ma ai.

English: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter.
Jinghpaw: Bawm shingmun gaw hkrang rai yawng mayawng hpe shachyaw ai lam hta npawt madung re ngu sawn la mai nga ai.

English: Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1.
Jinghpaw: Ndai gaw grai shuk ai mabyin rai nga nna dai kaw gaw electron ni e shinggrup tawn ai ka-ang nucleus hpe chye na loi hkra galaw da ai Bohr ladat, gintawng ni jan hpe shinggrup nga hte bung ai zawn re ai lam ni mung lawm nga ai. Sumla 1.1 hpe yu u.

English: The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons.
Jinghpaw: Nucleus hta neutrons hte protons ngu ai ayun ayaw lahkawng nga ai.

English: Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.
Jinghpaw: Neutron ni hta hpa dat la mung nnga ai shaloi proton kaw wan dat nga ai. Electron kaw gaw wan dat yi nga ai.

English: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety.
Jinghpaw: Tsim yam hkrum masha hpe jep yu na matu, nang gaw na shimlum lam hpe shateng lu na matu mabyin hpe shawng jep mada yu ra na re.

English: You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags.
Jinghpaw: Tsinyam hkrum ai wa hpe sa shani ai shaloi shi a shara masa hte shi hkrai shi byin pru wa ai hkrit hpa kumla masat dawnghkawn ni hpe mung sadi ra ai.

English: If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.
Jinghpaw: Lama na nang garum na matu shakut ai shaloi hkala nba hkrum la yang gaw, manghkang hpe sha grau kaba shangun na re.

English: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers.
Jinghpaw: Myit daw ai lam, hkrit ai lam hte tsin yam ai gaw mashi lawu machyi hkrum ai ni hta daw hten ai hte machyi ai lapran na matut mahkai lam hpe htinggram ya ai nga sawk tam ni hkaja da ma ai.

English: Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions.
Jinghpaw: Dai manghkang a majaw, myit ba ai ngut nna hkrit ai ni gaw PA hta bat shagu byin ai lam ni re.

English: Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.
Jinghpaw: Dai ayan galaw ai lamang ni hpe shang lawm ai lam hpe machyi taw ai ana hte shamu shamawt nmai ai a majaw machyi taw ai lam hpe garan ginghka ai shaloi na machyi ai a ntsa e rawng ai nkaja ai myit a matu madi shadaw ai lam grau ra ahkyak nga ai.

English: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes.
Jinghpaw: Mu ai lam (sh) mu lu ai atsam gaw myit hte mai mu lu ai hkum daw shan ni hta mahta ai.

English: There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism.
Jinghpaw: Myi hpe gawn lajang ai hta lam amyu myu hku tsi lajang ma ai, de a hkrung kanu ra rawng ai hta hkan nna ayak ahkak lajang ra ai.

English: The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.
Jinghpaw: Nbung ai gaw gap ladat ni gaw nbung ai atsam nga ma ai, dai ni gaw nbung ai shadawn shadang ni hte sung de lang ai degree ni nbung ai ma ai, kata de lang ai hpan nbung ai hku shachyaw ai rap ra ai hku galaw na nambat ni mung nbung ai ladat hku lang ma ai.

English: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area.
Jinghpaw: Masha jahpan gaw jaw da ai lamu ga kata na tup hkrak re myu baw hpan a hkrung kanu ni hpe mahkawng da ai re.

English: When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic.
Jinghpaw: Masha jahpang na dinghkrai shagu yawng hkra hpe hkrak tup re phenotypic lai nsam hku shabung dat ga nga yang yawng gaw monomorphic hku na chye na ai.

English: When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.
Jinghpaw: Dinghkrai shagu gaw alak mi re lai nsam a shai ai lam grai law hpe madun ai ten, shanhte gaw hkrang amyu myu galai ma ai.

English: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well.
Jinghpaw: Gagin law law gaw sa wa nna shanhte nga shara galaw dai hta mung grai hkrak wa ma ai.

English: In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day.
Jinghpaw: Ayan htawt hkawm ai madang hta gaw, gagyin hpyen hpung ni gaw shana hkawm nna shani hkring ma ai.

English: The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday.
Jinghpaw: Lusha mai lu ai lam yawm wa ai ten mung maden ai gaw ladaw jahkring hkring hta byin wa ai. Ndai ladaw ni hta mung maden ai gaw shani shagu na htawt sit galai taw ai jahkring mi na tsip tsip hpa re nga ai.

English: Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.
Jinghpaw: Ndai hkrup ai de hkawm sa ai lam (sh) yan hkawm ai lam langai ngai gaw ntsa lam nhtoi 17 na ai.

English: What is a cell? The word cell comes from the Latin word "cella", meaning "small room", and it was first coined by a microscopist observing the structure of cork.
Jinghpaw: Cell nga hpa ta? Dai cell nga gaw Latin ga kaw na gawk kasha ngu ai cella kaw na sa wa ai re, dai hpe shawng nnan microscopist hte palin matsun hpe jep yu ai kaw na hpang wa ai re.

English: The cell is the basic unit of all living things, and all organisms are composed of one or more cells.
Jinghpaw: Cell gaw sak hkrung ai lam yawng hkra hte a npawt re nna hkrung kanu yawng gaw cell langai grai law hte shang lawm gaw da ai re.

English: Cells are so basic and critical to the study of life, in fact, that they are often referred to as "the building blocks of life".
Jinghpaw: Cell ni gaw sak hkrung ai hpe hkaja na matu grai nan npawt nhpang re nga ai, grai ahkyak ai, hkrak tsun ga nga yang, "asak a gaw gap da ai gawk ni" zawn sha dai ni hpe jahkring hkring lakap da ai re.

English: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed.
Jinghpaw: Nervous system gaw a-kajawng sha byin wa ai nerve ni hpe sai lam matut bungli galaw na matu homeostaiss hkangzing ai lam hpe galaw ya nga ai.

English: These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.
Jinghpaw: Ndai myit maju lasa ni gaw hkum hkrang shara shagu de alawan du hkawm ai majaw hkum hkrang kaw byin mai ai hkrit hpa amyu myu kaw na makawp maga ya ai.

English: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path.
Jinghpaw: Bunghpoi laru gaw laga nbung laru ni rau shadawn ga nga yang gaw ginra kachyi myi sha hpe jahten kau ai raitimung shanhte a sa wa ai lam kaw nga ai arung arai hpa hkra hpe gaw jahten kau lu ai re.

English: Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours.
Jinghpaw: Bunghpoi laru ni gaw hpun ni hpe baw kau ai, nta hpun pyen ni gang je ai hte mawdaw ni hpe lamu de kabai shapyen kau ai. Bunghpoi laru a dawsa ai tsa lam shadang lahkawng gaw hkying hkum masum hta jan nna na ai.

English: These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
Jinghpaw: Dai grai kaba ai nbung laru hkying hkum mi hta 480 km (sekkan myi hta 133 minit;300 mph) hku bung ahpawt mat ai.

English: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years.
Jinghpaw: Shinggyim masha ni gaw shing hkying kaba kaw na sumla shawawm na matu pat nhpai ni hpe galaw shapraw ai hte jai lang wa ma ai.

English: However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century.
Jinghpaw: Raitimung, alat ningshawng jaw ai sumtsan yu myiset gaw lai wa tsa ban 16 hta uropa dan kaw galaw shapraw lai wa sai re.

English: These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.
Jinghpaw: Ndai sumtsan yu myi set ni gaw tsan ai kaw na arai ni hpe grau ni ai, grau kaba ai hku hpan lahkawng mai mu lu ai pat nhpai lahkawng hte shachyaw nna jai lang lai sai.

English: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly
Jinghpaw: Law hpa myit hte tinggyeng myit gaw galoi mung anhte hte arau nga nna ndai gaw masha law malawng wa mi gaw amyat lu wa ai shaloi, aten kadun hta grau nna lu wa hkra galaw na ngu ai tinggyeng myit jasat gaw shingra maka hte seng nna myit hpawm ai lam re nga ai.

English: Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.
Jinghpaw: Myit mada ai hte sha, masha law malawng gaw shanhte a aten galu kaja dik lata la mai ai gaw kaga ni hte rau bungli galaw na matu re ngu hpe dum hprang na matu re.

English: Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant.
Jinghpaw: Masha law law wa mi gaw shinggyim masha ni wa kaga shata mung hte kaga mungkan de sa du hkawm chyai lu na nhtoi hpe myit mada shinran nga ma ai rai nna masha nkau mi gaw dai shara de hpa wa mi nga ai kun ngu sumru yu ma ai rai ai, nkau mi kam ai gaw alak mi shai ai hkrung kanu (sh) kaga sak hkrung ai hpan ni wa kaga mungkan kaw nga ai ngu ai lam ni rai nga ai.

English: But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are "neighbors".
Jinghpaw: Lama na ndai lam ni wa byin wa tim grai na hkra byin taw na nre nga ai. Shagan ni gaw grai dam lada nna "htingbu" shagan wa hte deng trillions ram tsan hkat ai re.

English: Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?
Jinghpaw: Lani mi hta, na kashu gaw mungkan ntsa kaw tap nna moi na ji we ji wa ni hpe mau taw na re kun?

English: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move.
Jinghpaw: Dusat ni hpe cell law law hte hpa jang da ai re. Shanhte gaw lusha sha nna kan kata shat rin lam nga ai. Dusat malawng gaw shamu shamawt chye ma ai.

English: Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains).
Jinghpaw: Dusat ni hta sha bawnu rawng ai (tim dusat ni yawng hta gaw nrawng ai; lama na, panglai baluk hta bawnu nrawng ai).

English: Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.
Jinghpaw: Dusat dumyeng yawng hpe mungkan shara shagu hta mu lu nga ai. Shanhte gaw ga htu nga ai, nammuk dara nga ai hte lamu de pyen hkawm nga ma ai.

English: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism.
Jinghpaw: Shanhtum langai gaw sak hkrung (arai ni) hkrang kanu langai a kaji htum ai ninghtan gawgap lam hte seng ai hte bungli galaw ai lam hte seng ai hpan re.

English: Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room.
Jinghpaw: Cell ga si gaw Latin ga kaw na sa wa nna de lachyum gaw gawk kaji ngu ai re.

English: If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls.
Jinghpaw: Asak hkrung ai arai ni hpe microscope hte yu yu yang, shanhte hpe man bung lawk kaji ni shing nrai, bawlung kaji ni hte galaw da ai hpe mu lu na re.

English: Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope.
Jinghpaw: England mungdan na nsoi hpaji ninghkring Robert Hooke gaw microscope pat nhpai hte yu nna, matsut hta man bung lawk kaji ni hpe mu lu ai.

English: They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells
Jinghpaw: Dai ni hpe yu yang gawk ni zawn san ai. Shi gaw cell chyasi hpe shawng mu hkrup ai wa re.

English: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change.
Jinghpaw: Element hte compund ni hpe nshai ai sha shara langai hte langai mai htawt ai.

English: Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same.
Jinghpaw: Nitrogen gas gaw ntsin nitrogen zawn madang naw nga ai. Ntsin kaw loi htat tim molecule ni gaw maren re.

English: Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.
Jinghpaw: Hka gaw kaga ga shadawn langai re. Hka gahkyin ai lam hpe hydrogen atom lahkawng a lahta hte oxygen aton langai hte galaw da ai.

English: It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid.
Jinghpaw: Dai gaw dat nsa, ntsin (sh) atawng apa re mat tim de a molecular gaw da hkrang gaw maren sha re.

English: Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.
Jinghpaw: De a hkum shan hkrang shai mai timung, dat masa hkrang gaw nshai na re.

English: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand.
Jinghpaw: Aten ngu ai gaw anhte yawng a makau grupyin kaw nga ai, bai nna anhte galaw ai yawng mayawng kaw akyu pru ai, rai tim chye na na yak ai.

English: Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years.
Jinghpaw: Aten hpe moi shaning hkying hku na makam masham ninghkring, myit mang hpaji ninghkring hte hpungtang hpaji ninghkring ni gaw sharin hkaja wa sai.

English: We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past.
Jinghpaw: Anhte hta matut manoi lam yan byin nga ai zawn sha aten ahkying ni hpe mung htawm hpang kaw na ya ten lai sai ten du hkra hkrum nga ai.

English: Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events.
Jinghpaw: Aten ngu ai gaw lamang ni hta kade ram na ai hpe shingdaw maram yu ai hpe ngu mayu ai re.

English: You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.
Jinghpaw: Nang hku na kahtap mabyin langai kahtap byin ai lam hkaja da ai hku na lai mat wa sai na aten hpe mung ka matsing da mai ai. Kahtap mabyin langai gaw lama ma hpe ayan na lang hte lang byin taw ai re.

English: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos.
Jinghpaw: Dai ni na kumpyuta ni hpe sumla ni, video ni kung kyang ai hku jum lang na matu jai lang ai.

English: Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films.
Jinghpaw: Prat dep laklai ai animation ladat gaw kompyuta hte galaw shachyaw mai ai baw rai nna, ndai hpe TV hte sumla hkrung ni grau grau jai lang wa ma ai.

English: Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.
Jinghpaw: Yungwi hpe ayan na prat dep kompyuta lang nna nsen ni gayau lang na matu nsen rim da ai.

English: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas.
Jinghpaw: Tsa ban shi jahku hte hkun laman aten grai na hkra, New Zealand a shawng nga jauman masha ni gaw Maori masha ni re nna shanhte gaw maos ngu ai u kaba ni hpe shatam sha lai wa sai nga na kam lai wa ma ai.

English: The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society.
Jinghpaw: Maori masha ni Great Fleet a Polynesia kaw na bu htawt wa nna Moriori kaw na New Zealand de hkai nmai hte seng ai uhpung hpe hpaw ning htan ma ai gaw myit ningmu kaw na myit jasat de gaw shachyaw ma ai.

English: However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture.
Jinghpaw: Raiti mung hpaji jaw ai lam nnan ni hpaji jaw ai gaw, Moriori ni gaw New Zealand kaw na Chatham zinglawng de bu htawt lai wa ai kanu mungdan Maori hpung ni re. Shanhte na shanhte gadai rau nbung ai, simsa ai htung hking hpe galaw shahkut la ma ai.

English: There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand.
Jinghpaw: Chatham zinlawng kaw kaga amyu baw hpan ni naw nga nga ai re. Shanhte ni gaw New Zealand kaw na tsan ai de bu hkawm htawt sit mat ai Maori ngu ai ni re.

English: They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out
Jinghpaw: Shanhte hkum shanhte Moriori ngu shaga ai dai kaw gasat ai kachyi mi nga hpang chyhtum Moriori ni yang tsi mat ai.

English: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures.
Jinghpaw: Yak ai lam, hkrat sum lam ni hkrum kadup nga ai hpe chye nga ning leng dinghkrai shagu gaw anhte a n-gun atsam, myit katu ai lam hpe manu shadan let shi ban law law karum shingtau shanglawm ya lai wa sai.

English: While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization.
Jinghpaw: Marai langai ngai gaw shanhte a lam, dinghku a lam, hte magam bungli a lam ni hpaw tsun ai lam hpe madat ai shaloi, lai mat wa sai aten ni hte uhpung uhpawng ntsa kaja ai (sh) nkaja ai shingkang nga ai lailen nkau mi kaw na manu dan ai lam lu la ai.

English: While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization.
Jinghpaw: Labau hpe chye ai hte ladat hpe chye ai ngu nmai myit la ai, shanhte labau kaw hkrat sum ai ni hpe masha ni chye na ya na matu sha re.

English: While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization.
Jinghpaw: Awng dang lam hte hkrat sum lam chye na ai lam hpe jep maram ai ten dinghkrai shagu hte shanglawm ai masha yawng hkra hte gaw uhpung langai a manu, hkam la ai lit hte ganawng shaja ai lam ni hpe grau nna sung sung mu mada wa ai.

English: In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church.
Jinghpaw: Ndai ga shadawn hta, bungli madu myit rawng ai arawn alai hte awngdang lam a lai sai ten na ga shadawn ni bai dum ai lam gaw buga nawku hpung a matu galai shai lam nnan re nna lam mahkrun nnan shabyin ya ai.

English: Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.
Jinghpaw: Dai zawn re awng dang ai mau mwi ni gaw, shawng lam hta galai shai ai lam galaw na matu kaja ai hku mu na hpe ra sharawng ai myit ni hpe myit shapraw taw ai shaloi galai shai na hpe hkrit taw ai myit ni hpe shayawm kau ya nga ai.

English: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution.
Jinghpaw: Shara langai kaw majaw nna myit sumru ai maka ni gaw nbung ai ningmu ni hte gaiwangs ni hpe mahtai lu na na matu pawng hkawm shangun ai manghkang hparan ai ladat ni rai nga ai.

English: The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information.
Jinghpaw: Ndai myit ningmu a maju gindai gaw lawan ladan masa, sawn dinglik masa, tup hkrak teng ai lam, lawnglam ni hpe madi shadaw ai lam, nga nga chyalu ladat hpaji ni hpe bai jai lang ai lam ni hte shiga lamang ni hpe mahkawng la ai lam ni rai nga ai.

English: The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong.
Jinghpaw: Ndai myit a ahkyak dik npawt gaw: dai hta e mahtai jaw ai langai sha nga ai. Nang gaw jaw ai shut ai ngu tsun na mahtai lahkawn hpe sha mai myit ai.

English: This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures.
Jinghpaw: Ning re myit ai hpan gaw teng ai hpungtang hpaji madang nga ai bungli mahkrun hte matut manoi ai re.

English: People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.
Jinghpaw: Dai zawn chye myit ai ni gaw kaja ai hku myit ai re, dai masha ni gaw chye myit dum ai, manghkang chye hpran ai ngut nna mungkan hpaji ni hpe chye galaw ma ai.

English: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others.
Jinghpaw: Shinggyim masha ni gaw kaga ni a myit ni hpe hti sumru ai lam na atsam rawng htum ai amyu baw hpan rai nga ai.

English: That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire.
Jinghpaw: De lachyum gaw shinggyim masha ni gara hku shadum la ai lam, yaw shada lam, kam sham ai lam, chye na ai lam hte ra marit ai lam ni hpe awng dang ai hku tau chye na lu ai ngu ai re.

English: Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions.
Jinghpaw: Ndai atsam ni kaw gaw, laga masha hpe myit sawn ya ai lam hpe chyena hkawnhkrang ai lam gaw a hkyak madung re. ndai lam ni gaw anhte hpe myit npyaw ai lam byin mai ai hkrang hte shamawt hkawm ai lam ni hpe hparan lu shangun nga ai.

English: For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car.
Jinghpaw: Ga shadawn, lama nang hku na mawdaw pat hpe langai ngai shaga ai hpe nang mu yang, nang gaw dai wa jasam a mawdaw hpe lagu na shakut taw ai ngu nang tak la na re.

English: He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.
Jinghpaw: Lama shi gaw shi mawdaw zaw shamat kau ai rai yang ngu ai hte shi mawdaw hpe shi nan jahten taw ai rai yang, shi hpe tara dara ai lam nmai bung ai.

English: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University).
Jinghpaw: MRI gaw Felix Bloch (Stanford Dakkasu hta magam gun) hte Edward Purcell (Harvard Dakkasu hta magam gun) kaw nna shaning 1930 hkan mu sawk la nna, nukalia (nuclear) hpri sharaw nsen atsam (NMR) ngut tsun ai hkrang jasat byin yan hta mahta ai re.

English: In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals.
Jinghpaw: Ndai kadu nsen hta, agang la ai lam hte radio leng gaw radio masat kumla ni hpe shapraw ya na matu atom ni shabyin ai.

English: In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis.
Jinghpaw: 1970 ning hta, tsi du hte sawk sagawn ninghkring, Raymond Damidian gaw ana tam sagawn ai hking hku langai hku na hpri sharaw na pru ai nsen hte jai lang ai baw hpe sawk tam lu wa ai.

English: Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI.
Jinghpaw: Mali ning na mat ai hpang, hkrang madu ahkaw ahkang langai myi hpe jaw lai wa sai. Dai gaw MRI shing wang kata na mungkan ting a nambat langai hkrang madu ahkaw ahkang hpe ahkyak tawn ai lam rai lai wa sai.

English: In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.
Jinghpaw: 1977 hta Dr. Damadian gaw shawng na "hkum hkrang ting" jep ai baw MRI scanner hpe galaw shapraw ngut sai, dai hpe shi gaw "da kring da lang re ai" ngu shaga ai.

English: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others.
Jinghpaw: Asynchronous matut mahkai ai lam gaw kaga ni hpe nhtoi shingna ahkung ai na hte ginhtang galaw na matu aten hpe n-gun jaw ya nga ai.

English: It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information.
Jinghpaw: Ndai gaw jawng ma ni hpe shanhte na shahte lagaw lahkam hta bungli galaw lu na atsam hte shiga matsun madun ai hte seng ai lagaw lahkam ni hpe reng hkang na matu atsam marai ni hpe jaw ya nga ai.

English: In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998)
Jinghpaw: Matut nna gaw, bunli galaw ai aten hpe galai sha na byin mai na lam kaw kachyi mi nga na re. (Bremer,1998)

English: The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times.
Jinghpaw: Internet hte World Wide Web jai lang ai gaw hkaja ai ni a matu aten tup shiga lamang ni hpe mai hkaja na ahkang nga ai.

English: Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.
Jinghpaw: Jawngma ni hku nna ma sara ni hpe chye mayu ai ga san ni htap htuk manu ai hte lawan ai hku mahtai lu la na matu, hpang kalang myi man hkrum sharin na ten du hkra nla ai sha, aten shagu shara shagu hta mai tang shawn ai.

English: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn.
Jinghpaw: Postmodern sharin achyin ai ladat gaw gip gyeng ai kaw na wang lu wang lang re ai de sa wa sai re. Sharin la na lam kaja ai lam langai mung nnga ai.

English: In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented.
Jinghpaw: Kaja nga yang gaw, gara lam mung sharin hkaja la na n ra ai. Hpaji hpe hkaja la ai wa a mahkrum madup hte sharin da ya ai machye machyang a ka'ang e sharin hkam la ai lam byin tai wa ai re.

English: Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point.
Jinghpaw: Anhte ndai laman hkrum da ai mahkrum madup ni rai nga ai tinang hkrai galaw la ra ai lam ni hte shiga lamang tang madun ai ni, sharin hkaja la mai ai hkrangmu shiga lamang ni hpe yu nna ndai lam hpe mu lu mai nga ai.

English: So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge.
Jinghpaw: Anhte law malawng gaw tinang kaja wa ta tut galaw na nre ai shing nrai, jai lang na nrai nga ai amu lam yan ni hpe htawng madun da ai TV lamang ni hpe yu nga ma ai hpe mu chye lu ai.

English: We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.
Jinghpaw: Anhte gaw mawdaw langai hpe ntsa lam sha jep ai lam, anhte na sun wang kata kaw hka hpawk galaw ai lam, moina hten za mat ai ni hpe hkaja na matu Peru de sa du hkawm ai lam, (sh) anhte a htingbu wa a nta hpe bai shatsawm garam ai lam galoi mung n-galaw ga ai.

English: Thanks to undersea fiber optic cable links to Europe and broadband satellite, Greenland is well connected with 93% of the population having internet access.
Jinghpaw: Pang lai npu hku na dawn la da ai fiber wan sumri lahkra da ai Uropa hte jak shagan (satellite) ni hpe chyeju kaba sai, Greenland kaw masha yawng a 93% gaw internet atsawm lu lang ma ai.

English: Your hotel or hosts (if staying in a guesthouse or private home) will likely have wifi or an internet connected PC, and all settlements have an internet cafe or some location with public wifi.
Jinghpaw: Na manam jarik (nang manam jarik dai nrai nta kaw nga taw yang) pc hte matut da ai internet dai nrai wifi nga na re. shara shagu kaw internet café dai nrai nkau shara kaw wifi nga ai.

English: As mentioned above, though the word "Eskimo" remains acceptable in the United States, it is considered pejorative by many non-U.S. Arctic peoples, especially in Canada.
Jinghpaw: Shawng hta tsun sai hte maren, "Eskimo" ga si gaw United States hta hkap la mai ai hku naw ngam ai rai timung, US nre ai masha grai law gaw shanhte hpe jahpoi ahpyak ai hku mu mada ma ai. Grai lagyi ai ginra na masha ni, grau nna gaw Canada kaw nga ma ai.

English: While you may hear the word used by Greenlandic Natives, its use should be avoided by foreigners.
Jinghpaw: Nang hku na Greenlandic Jau man bu ni shaga ai ga na ai ten, mai gan manam ni hku dai ga ni hpe koi gam ging ai.

English: The native inhabitants of Greenland call themselves Inuit in Canada and Kalaalleq (plural Kalaallit), a Greenlander, in Greenland.
Jinghpaw: Greenland kaw na ai masha ni gaw shanhte hkum shanhte Caneda hte Kalaalleq (Kalaallit) kaw na Inuit nga shaga nna Greenland hta gaw Greenlander masha ngu shaga la ma ai.

English: Crime, and ill-will toward foreigners in general, is virtually unknown in Greenland. Even in the towns, there are no "rough areas."
Jinghpaw: Ru hka amu hte law malawng hku nna maigan masha ni hpe nju ndawng ai myit ni gaw Greenland kaw nau nmu lu ai daram re ai. Mare nhtawng ni hkan e mung laja lana re ai gin ra ni mung n-nga ai re.

English: Cold weather is perhaps the only real danger the unprepared will face.
Jinghpaw: Katsi ai lamu marang masa gaw hkyen lajang da ai lam n nga ai ni hkrum sha chye ai shoihpa langai rai nga ai.

English: If you visit Greenland during cold seasons (considering that the further north you go, the colder it will be), it is essential to bring warm enough clothing.
Jinghpaw: Nshung ta hta Greenland de sa chyai ai rai yang (dingdung maga de sa magang katsi magang re hpe dum u), lum ai buhpun palawng law law la sa ging ai.

English: The very long days in the summer can lead to problems getting sufficient sleep and associated health issues.
Jinghpaw: Ginhtawng ta na nhtoi galu ai lam ni gaw yup nhkru ai manghkang ni byin shangun nna dai hte seng ai hkam ja lam manghkang ni hpe byin shangun nga ai.

English: During the summer, also watch out for the Nordic mosquitoes. Although they do not transmit any diseases, they can be irritating.
Jinghpaw: Ginhtawng ta hta e, Nordic (Uropa dan hte seng ai) jigrawng ni hpe mung sadi ra ai. Dai ni gaw ana li n shabra tim pyi kaprep ai, machyi ai lam byin chye ai.

English: While San Francisco's economy is linked to it being a world-class tourist attraction, its economy is diversified.
Jinghpaw: San Francisco na bungli gaw mungkan kaw na sa chyai ai masha ni hte seng taw ai shaloi, dai hpe garan wa ai.

English: The largest employment sectors are professional services, government, finance, trade, and tourism.
Jinghpaw: Kaba htum ai bungli jaw ya ai bungli dabang ni gaw kan bau bungli jaw ya ai lam ni, asuya uhpung, jagum hpraw dap, gunrai htaw shalai hpung ni hte maigan bu hkawm magam bungli ni rai nga ai.

English: Its frequent portrayal in music, films, literature and popular culture has helped make the city and its landmarks known throughout the world.
Jinghpaw: Dai mahkawn, sumla hkrung, laili laika ngut nna myit kaba ai ladat ni a hkrang ni gaw myu ni hpe madi shadaw ai re ngut nna mungkan hta dai ni a majaw mying kaba ai.

English: San Francisco has developed a large tourist infrastructure with numerous hotels, restaurants, and top-notch convention facilities.
Jinghpaw: San Francisco gaw mungkan buhkawm ai lam hte seng nna ningpawt ninghpang ra madung re nga ai manam jarawp kaba law law, lu sha seng kaba ni hte tsaw dik madang zuphpawng ginra nta kaba ni hpe gaw sharawt la ngut sai re.

English: San Francisco is also one of the best places in the nation for other Asian cuisine: Korean, Thai, Indian, and Japanese.
Jinghpaw: San Francisco gaw mungdan kaw nga ai Asha dan: Korea, Thai, Kala hte Japan masha ni a lusha mai lu ai hkrak dik htum ai shara ni kaw na langai rai nga ai.

English: Traveling to Walt Disney World represents a major pilgrimage for many American families.
Jinghpaw: Walt Disney Mungkan de sa du hkawm chyai ai lam gaw Amerikan dinghku masha law law a matu nawku hpung hte seng nna hkawm ai zawn re nga ai.

English: The "typical" visit involves flying into Orlando International Airport, busing to an on-site Disney hotel, spending about a week without leaving Disney property, and returning home.
Jinghpaw: Ayang gaw Orlando nbungli dabang de sa, Disney manam jarik de mawdaw htee bai sa, dai kaw bat mi daram hkawm chyai ngut nna nta bai wa ai hku re.

English: There are infinite variations possible, but this remains what most people mean when they talk of "going to Disney World".
Jinghpaw: Dai kaw mahtai amyu myu hkum sum hpa mai bying ai, raitim ndai gaw masha malawng gaw "Disney Mungkan de sa na" ngu shanhte tsun ai shaloi na ten hpe shadum ya ai.

English: Many tickets sold online through auction websites such as eBay or Craigslist are partially used multi-day park-hopper tickets.
Jinghpaw: Manu shingjawng dut ai website ni re nga ai online ntsa eBay (sh) Craigslist kaw na dut ai lakmat ni gaw shani mga law law dut da ai ni re.

English: While this is a very common activity, it is prohibited by Disney: the tickets are non-transferable.
Jinghpaw: Ndai gaw madung galaw ai lamang rai ai majaw Disney kaw na mung lakmat ni hpe shada garan hkat na matu mung hkum pat tawn da ai re.

English: Any camping below the rim in Grand Canyon requires a backcountry permit.
Jinghpaw: Grand Canyon htinggawt npu na kaga shara hkan de camping pru na nga yang gaw laksan ahkang jaw lakmat la ra na re.

English: Permits are limited to protect the canyon, and become available on the 1st day of the month, four months prior to the start month.
Jinghpaw: Krung sinwa hpe makawp maga na matu ahkaw ahkang jaw ai ni gaw shadaw sharam nga ai, dai lakmat gaw shata mi a 1st ya, shawng hpang ai shata na matu shata mali jau na mai lu ai.

English: Thus, a backcountry permit for any start date in May becomes available on 1 Jan.
Jinghpaw: Dai majaw, Masha nau nnga ai mungdan kaw nga lu na matu gaw May kaw na hpang nna 1 Jan du hkra re.

English: Space for the most popular areas, such as the Bright Angel Campground adjacent to Phantom Ranch, generally fill up by the requests received on first date they are opened to reservations.
Jinghpaw: Phantom Ranch makau na Bright Angel Campground zawn re mying kaba ai shara hta law malawng karum hpyi ai ni a majaw shawng nnan nhtoi hta jahpan hpring ai, dai na matu alak mi hku na jahpan hpaw da ai.

English: There are a limited number permits reserved for walk-in requests available on a first come, first served basis.
Jinghpaw: Dai ni gaw shawng nnan walk-in shawng htet ai lam hta mare kade ngu galaw da ai re.

English: Entering Southern Africa by car is an amazing way to see all the region's beauty as well as to get to places off the normal tourist routes.
Jinghpaw: Mawdaw hte dingda Africa de shangwa ai lam gaw ginra a tsawm htap ai yawng hte ayan mungkan bu hkawm masha ni hkawm ai lam na shara hkan lu du hkring yu lu na matu mau hpa lam ladat re.

English: This can be done in a normal car with careful planning but a 4x4 is highly advised and many locations are only accessible with a high wheel base 4x4.
Jinghpaw: Ndai hpe yu maya mawdaw kaw nga yang masing atsawm jahkrat ra na raitim 4x4 hpe gaw grai madi shadaw ai, hkrun lam law law gaw 4x4 zawn re tsaw ai leng hte she hkawm sa lu ai.

English: Keep in mind while planning that although Southern Africa is stable not all neighboring countries are.
Jinghpaw: Dingdung Africa gaw kaja tim laga makau mungdan ni gaw nkaja shaloi myit hta sha bang da u.

English: Visa requirements and costs vary from nation to nation and are affected by the country you come from.
Jinghpaw: Mungdan shang lakmat a matu ra rawng ai lam ni hte manu jahpu ni gaw mungdan langai hte langai shai nna, nang sa wa ai mungdan hte mung seng ai.

English: Each country also has unique laws requiring what emergency items need to be in the car.
Jinghpaw: Mungdan shagu gaw mawdaw kata kaw ra wa mai ai ahkyak ahkya arung arai ni hpe bang tawn da na matu laklai ai tara upadi ni nga ai re.

English: Victoria Falls is a town in the western portion of Zimbabwe, across the border from Livingstone, Zambia, and near Botswana.
Jinghpaw: Victoria Hka rum ni gaw Zimbabwe mungdan a sinna maga daw kaw na mare langai mi rai nna, Zambia mungdan na Livingstone mare kaba hte Botswan mare makau na jarit mayan re nga ai.

English: The town lies immediately next to the falls, and they are the major attraction, but this popular tourist destination offers both adventure seekers and sightseers plenty of opportunities for a longer stay.
Jinghpaw: Dai mare kaba gaw hka rum lahkawng makau kaw sha re, ngut na dai hka rum yan gaw madung myit shang sha shara re, raitim ndai sumtsan manam mying kaba shara gaw loi na na nga na matu yu chyai shara law la ai hte nhkrit ntsang hkawm sa mayu ai ni a matu shara re.

English: In the rainy season (November to March), the water volume will be higher and the Falls will be more dramatic.
Jinghpaw: Yanam ta hta (shata man shi langai kaw na shata man matsum), hka shadang grau jaw wa na ra ai hte Mangai ta hta gaw grau hkamsha pyaw na ra ai.

English: You are guaranteed to get wet if you cross the bridge or walk along the trails winding near the Falls.
Jinghpaw: Lama na nang hkarum makau na mahkrai hku lai wa ai wanleng lam hku hkawm lai wa shaloi nang madi mat na re ngu pahkam hkam ai.

English: On the other hand, it is precisely because the volume of water is so high that your viewing of the actual Falls will be obscured—by all the water!
Jinghpaw: Maga mi hku yu ga nga yang, ndai gaw hka yang hta tup hkrak jaw ai re hpa majaw nga yang hka a hkrang shadang gaw grai tsaw nna nang hka rum hpe kaja yu ai lam hpe shingdang ya hkrum na re.

English: Tomb of Tutankhamun (KV62). KV62 may be the most famous of the tombs in the Valley, the scene of Howard Carter's 1922 discovery of the almost intact royal burial of the young king.
Jinghpaw: Tutanhkamun a lup (KV62). 1922 a Howard Carter na a sak kaji ai hkaw hkam a lup wa dingsa hpe mu tam ai ginra re ai, KV62 gaw dai hkaraw kaw na mying kaba dik ai lup rai na re.

English: Compared to most of the other royal tombs, however, the tomb of Tutankhamun is barely worth visiting, being much smaller and with limited decoration.
Jinghpaw: Kaga hkaw hkam ni hte seng ai lup law malawng rau shingdaw yang, Tutankhamun a lup wa gaw grau kaji ai hte shadawn nna shatsawm tawn ai lam hte re ai majaw sa wam du hkawm na matu nau n-grin dan nga ai.

English: Anyone interested in seeing evidence of the damage to the mummy done during attempts to remove it from the coffin will be disappointed as only the head and shoulders are visible.
Jinghpaw: Mang jahraw hpe da-u kaw na shaw na matu galaw ai shaloi hten mat ai lam sakse hpe yu na matu myit lawm ai masha kadai raitimung, baw hte lahpa ni hpe sha mai mu lu ai re majaw myit daw mat na re.

English: The fabulous riches of the tomb are no longer in it, but have been removed to the Egyptian Museum in Cairo.
Jinghpaw: Grai kaba hkik hkam ai lup ni gaw dai kaw nnga sai, raitim dai ni hpe Cairo na Egyptian Madun Htingnu de htawt dat ai.

English: Visitors with limited time would be best to spend their time elsewhere.
Jinghpaw: Aten nau nlu ai sa chyai ai ni gaw laga shara kaw sa ai grau hkrak na re.

English: Phnom Krom, 12 km southwest of Siem Reap. This hilltop temple was built at the end of the 9th century, during the reign of King Yasovarman.
Jinghpaw: Phnom Krom nawku jawng gaw Siem Reap a dingda sinna maga a 12 km tsan ai kaw nga ai re. Ndai bum pungding nawku jawng gaw tsa ban 19 htum wa maga, Yasovarman hkaw hkam wa up ai ten ladaw hta gaw gap lai wa ai re.

English: The gloomy atmosphere of the temple and the view over the Tonle Sap lake make the climb to the hill worthwhile.
Jinghpaw: Dai numri kaput taw ai nawku jawng hte Tonle Sap hka lawng nta kaw na mu ai gaw dai kawng lu ai hpe mau shadan ai lam re.

English: A visit to the site can be conveniently combined with a boat trip to the lake.
Jinghpaw: Ginra shara de hkawm chyai ai lam gaw nawng de hkali jawn nna hkawm ai hte arau galaw mai nga ai.

English: The Angkor Pass is needed to enter the temple so do not forget to bring your passport along when heading to Tonle Sap.
Jinghpaw: Angkor Pass nawku jawng de shang ra ai dai majaw Tonle Sap de sa yang passport la wa na hkum ma lap u.

English: Jerusalem is the capital and largest city of Israel, though most other countries and the United Nations do not recognize it as Israel's capital.
Jinghpaw: Yerusalem gaw Israel mungdan a mare daju rai nga ai. Rai timung, kaga mungdan ni hte Unitd Nations hpung kaw na gaw dai hku n hkap la ma ai.

English: The ancient city in the Judean Hills has a fascinating history spanning thousands of years.
Jinghpaw: Dai Judean bum kaw na myu kaw moi shaning sen hku kaw na labau kaja ni nga ai.

English: The city is holy to the three monotheistic religions - Judaism, Christianity and Islam, and serves as a spiritual, religious, and cultural center.
Jinghpaw: Dai mare kaba gaw makam masum a matu chyoipra nga ai - Yuda makam, Hkristan, hte Islam ni rai nga ai, bai nna wenyi, makam hte htunghking madung shara mung rai nga ai.

English: Due to the religious significance of the city, and in particular the many sites of the Old City area, Jerusalem is one of the main tourist destinations in Israel.
Jinghpaw: Mare kaba a nawku htung hte ahkyak ai lam ni hte mare ginwang a laksan shara ni a majaw Yerusalem gaw Israela mung na bu hkawm shara ni a madung kaw lawm nga ai.

English: Jerusalem has many historic, archeological and cultural sites, along with vibrant and crowded shopping centers, cafés, and restaurants.
Jinghpaw: Yerusalem gaw labau lam, labu htu sagawn lam hte htunghking hte seng ai shara law law nga ai, dai hta n-ga gat ka'ang seng ni, kohpi hte lusha seng ni hpring kamawg ai shara mung re.

English: Ecuador requires that Cuban citizens receive an invitation letter prior to entering Ecuador through international airports or frontier admission points.
Jinghpaw: Ecuador gaw Ecuador de shang na matu mungdan ga daga hte seng ai pyenli daru ni hku na lamu ga jarik shang na lamyi laman lu ai hku na Cuban mungchying masat laika lu ra ai.

English: This letter must be legalized by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Foreign Affairs, and comply with certain requirements.
Jinghpaw: Kaja ra ahkyak ai ni hpe myit hkrum let, Ecuadorian a Maigan Kyit Hkai Dap kaw na ndai laika hpe tara shang galaw ya ra ai.

English: These requirements are designed to provide an organized migratory flow between both countries.
Jinghpaw: Ndai ra gadawn ai lam ni hpe mungdan lahkawng lapran shara mi na shara mi atsawm hkrang hkra shajin da ai hpe lajang na matu gyin sawn hpajang da ai re.

English: Cuban citizens who are US green card holders should visit an Ecuadorian Consulate to obtain an exemption to this requirement.
Jinghpaw: Cuban mungchying masha re nna US kat pa tsit (mai nga ai card) lang da ai ni gaw Ekwidaw mungdan sumtsan kasa ni kaw mara lawt ahkaw ahkang lu na matu sa mu hkrum ra ai.

English: Your passport must be valid for at least 6 months beyond your travel dates. A round/onward trip ticket is needed to prove the length of your stay.
Jinghpaw: Hkrum lam nhkawm shi yang na passport shata 6 daram nu nga ra ai. Sa na wa na / sa na sha lengmak a matu nang gada ya nga na hpe madun ra ai.

English: Tours are cheaper for larger groups, so if you're by yourself or with just one friend, try to meet other people and form a group of four to six for a better per-person rate.
Jinghpaw: Bu hkawm ai magam gaw masha uhpung kaba ni a matu gaw grau manu hpa ai re. Dai majaw lama na nang hkrai sha manang langai hte sha rai yang gaw, masha langai hkrai a manu gau hkyemsa na matu mali kaw na kru du hkra re ai masha uhpung hkrang pru wa hkra laga masha ni hte hkrum tsup na matu shakut u.

English: However, this shouldn't really be off your concern, because often tourists are shuffled around to fill the cars.
Jinghpaw: Raitim, nang myit ntang ra ai, hpa majaw nga yang sa chyai ai ni gaw mawdaw hpring tup sa taw ma ai.

English: It seems actually to be more a way of tricking people into believing they have to pay more.
Jinghpaw: Dai gaw masha ni hpe shanhte gumhpraw grau nna jaw ra ai ngu shadu wa hkra galaw ai maw lanyet ai lam hte kaja nan grau bung wa nga ai.

English: Towering above the north end of Machu Picchu is this steep mountain, often the backdrop to many photos of the ruins.
Jinghpaw: Machu Picchu a lahta kaw na tower gaw grai tsaw ai bum re, chyhkring hkring sumla chyhten ni hta mu lu ai.

English: It looks a bit daunting from below, and it is a steep and difficult ascent, but most reasonably fit persons should be able to make it in about 45 minutes.
Jinghpaw: Lawu kaw na yu yang loi hkrit ra na zawn zawn, lung na matu yak ai zawn san tim hkum hkrang n-gun ja hkam kaja ai ni gaw minit 45 laman hta hkawm sa lu ai.

English: Stone steps are laid along most of the path, and in the steeper sections steel cables provide a supporting handrail.
Jinghpaw: Nlung ni hpe lam ding yang hta jahkrat tawn da nna hpri gang sumri hte lata jum mai ai hku hkrai hkrai da ai.

English: That said, expect to be out of breath, and take care in the steeper portions, especially when wet, as it can become dangerous quickly.
Jinghpaw: Dai tsun lai wa ai gaw, n'sa matut sa na matu myit mada ai hte grau kadawng ai daw hta sadi u, grau nna gaw madi taw ai shaloi ndai gaw a-lawan sha hkrit tsang hpa shara byin chye wa ai re.

English: There's a tiny cave near the top that must be passed through, it is quite low and a rather tight squeeze.
Jinghpaw: Ntsa maga makau de na lung pu kaji langai hpe lai ra na re. Dai lung pu gaw loi nem nna ram ram chyat ai re.

English: Seeing the sites and wildlife of the Galapagos is best done by boat, just as Charles Darwin did it in 1835.
Jinghpaw: 1835 ning hta Charles Darwin galaw ai zawn, Galapagos kaw nga ai ginra ni hte du sat dumyeng ni hpe gaw hka li hte yu chyai pyaw dik htum re.

English: Over 60 cruise ships ply the Galapagos waters - ranging in size from 8 to 100 passengers.
Jinghpaw: Galapagos hka kaw masha 8 kaw na 100 daram htaw nna sanghpaw 60 daram htawsa htawwa galaw taw ai.

English: Most people book their place well in advance (as the boats are usually full during the high season).
Jinghpaw: Masha law malawng gaw lawan wan shawng htet da ma ai (dai sanghpaw gaw ndai shata hta ayan masha hpring ai majaw).

English: Be sure the agent through whom you book is a Galapagos specialist with a good knowledge of a wide variety of ships.
Jinghpaw: Nang tau hkrau shap ai lam galaw ai dat kasa gaw sanghpaw ni a lam atsawm chye ai Galapagos laksan kungkyang ai masha rai u ga.

English: This will ensure that your particular interests and/or constraints are matched with the ship most suitable to them.
Jinghpaw: Ndai gaw nang na laksan myit lawm ai lam hte shagwi ai lam gaw shanhte hte htap htuk htum sanghpaw hte htap htuk nga ai.

English: Before the Spanish arrived in the 16th century, northern Chile was under Inca rule while the indigenous Araucanians (Mapuche) inhabited central and southern Chile.
Jinghpaw: 16th century hta Spain ni ndu shit yang, dingda Chile hpe Inca ni aup hkang ai re dai shaloi Araucanians masha (Mapuche) ni Chile kaang hte dingdung kaw nga ma ai.

English: The Mapuche were also one of the last independent American indigenous groups, that were not fully absorbed into Spanish-speaking rule until after Chile's independence.
Jinghpaw: Mapuche ni gaw hpang jahtum shanglawt lu ai American myu kaji hpung ni re nna shanhte hpe Chile ni shanglawt lu du hkra Spain ga shaga na matu shalawm la ma ai.

English: Although Chile declared independence in 1810 (amid the Napoleonic wars that left Spain without a functioning central government for a couple of years), decisive victory over the Spanish was not achieved until 1818.
Jinghpaw: Chile gaw 1810 hta rawt malan sai ngu ndau tim mung (Napoleonic majan lapran shaning law law hta Spain ni gaw mungdan up hkang ai bungli atsawm nlu galaw wa ai), gaja sha Spanish hpe shaning 1818 du hkra nlu dang manga la ma ai.

English: The Dominican Republic (Spanish: República Dominicana) is a Caribbean country that occupies the eastern half of the island of Hispaniola, which it shares with Haiti
Jinghpaw: Dominican Republic (Spanish: Republica Dominicana) gaw Haiti hte rau Hispaniola zinlawng a singpraw maga chyen mi hpe up hkang lai wa ai Caribbean mungdan langai re.

English: Besides white sand beaches and mountain landscapes, the country is home to the oldest European city in the Americas, now part of Santo Domingo.
Jinghpaw: Panglai zaibru jang ahpraw hte bum maling ni hta n-ga, dai mungdan, ya na Santo Domingo daw gaw America ni hta na moi shawng de na Europa mare kaba langai na mungdan nta re.

English: The island was first inhabited by the Taínos and Caribes. The Caribes were an Arawakan-speaking people who had arrived around 10,000 BCE.
Jinghpaw: Ndai ginlawng hta Taiˊno hte Caribe ni shawng shingbyi nga hpang wa sai. Caribe ni gaw BCE 10,000 daram na nga hpang nna Arawakan aga shaga ai ni re ma ai.

English: Within a few short years following the arrival of European explorers, the population of Tainos had significantly been reduced by the Spanish conquerors
Jinghpaw: Europa sawk tam maram masha ni du ai hpang shaning kadun laman hta Tainos a masha jahpan hpe gaw dang ka'up sha ai Spain masha ni kawn alak mi re nna shayawm kau ya ai hkrum lai wa sai.

English: Based on Fray Bartolomé de las Casas (Tratado de las Indias) between 1492 and 1498 the Spanish conquerors killed around 100,000 Taínos.
Jinghpaw: Fray Bartolome de las Casas a laika buk Tratado de las Indias hku nga yang gaw, shaning 1492 hte shaning 1498 lapran hta padang dip lu ai Spain ni gaw Tainos masha 100,000 daram sat kau lai wa sai.

English: Jardín de la Unión. This space was built as the atrium for a 17th-century convent, of which the Templo de San Diego is the sole surviving building.
Jinghpaw: Jardin de la Union. Dai shara hpe 17th-century a ma ma nawku jawng hku shachyaw wa ai, dai gaw Templo de San Diego kaw na langai sha ngam taw ai re.

English: It now functions as the central plaza, and always has a lot of things going on, day and night.
Jinghpaw: Ya gaw dai gaw madung gat kaba zawn rai taw sai rai nna shani shana arai law law ni hpe mai lu nga sai re.

English: There are a number of restaurants surrounding the garden, and in the afternoons and evening there free concerts are often given from the central gazebo.
Jinghpaw: Dai kaw nampan sun hpe shinggrup da ai lusha seng ni grai law hkra nga nna, chyingtung lai ten hte shana de hkan ginra nta kasha daju kaw gumhpraw n jaw ra ai yungwi pinra ni nga chye ai.

English: Callejon del Beso (Alley of the Kiss). Two balconies separated by only 69 centimeters is home of an old love legend.
Jinghpaw: Callejon Del Beso (Kiss na lam lapran). 69 centimeter sha gang nna galaw da ai nbang pinra lahkawng gaw moi na tsaw ra hkat ai lam a dum nta rai nga ai.

English: For a few pennies some children will tell you the story.
Jinghpaw: Gumhpraw dengga kachyi mi a majaw ma nkau mi gaw nang hpe mau mwi tsun dan na re.

English: Bowen Island is a popular day trip or weekend excursion offering kayaking, hiking, shops, restaurants, and more.
Jinghpaw: Bowen shara gaw lani mi hkrum lam hta mying grai kaba ai re dai nrai bungli pat ai shani hta kayaking jawn ai, bum lung ai, gat mari ai, lung sha seng hte laga ni nga ai re.

English: This authentic community is located in Howe Sound just off Vancouver, and is easily accessed via scheduled water taxis departing Granville Island in downtown Vancouver.
Jinghpaw: Ndai jet ai uhpung gaw, Vancouver a Howe Sound mayan kaw shanu nga ai re nna shap hka-mawdaw hte Vancouver mare kaw na Granville zimlom na tau hkrau shajin na mai rawt sa ai re.

English: For those who enjoy outdoor activities, a trek up the Sea to Sky corridor is essential.
Jinghpaw: Shinggan lamang ni hpe pyaw dum ai ni a matu gaw, pang lai makau hku hkan nna lamu htingwung lam de lam galu hkawm ai lam gaw ra madung rai nga ai.

English: Whistler (1.5 hour drive from Vancouver) is expensive but well-known because of the 2010 Winter Olympics.
Jinghpaw: Whistler (Vancouver kaw na hking hkum 1.5 ram gau ai) gaw manu hpu ai raitim 2010 Kashung ta Oylmpic a majaw mying gumhkawng nga ai.

English: In the winter, enjoy some of the best skiing in North America, and in the summer try some authentic mountain biking.
Jinghpaw: Nshung ta hta, Amerika Dingdung hta kaja dik ai hkyen pa hpan hte myit pyaw lam la u, ginhtawng ta hta gaw kaja nga ai bum de gaw leng jawn chyam yu u.

English: Permits must be reserved in advance. You must have a permit to stay overnight at Sirena.
Jinghpaw: Ahkang aya hpe tau hkrau hpyi da ra na. Nang hku na Sirena kaw lana mi nga shalai yang ahkang hpyi la ra na.

English: Sirena is the only ranger station that offers dormitory lodging and hot meals in addition to camping. La Leona, San Pedrillo, and Los Patos offer only camping with no food service.
Jinghpaw: Sirena gaw camping hta jan na shana yup mai ai manam jarawp hte kahtet hpoi hpoi lusha ni ma jaw ai namkawn du dabang rai nga ai. La Leona, San Pedrillo hte Los Patos ni hkan gaw camping sha mai galaw nna malu masha lajang ya ai lam ni n nga ai.

English: It is possible to secure park permits directly from the Ranger Station in Puerto Jiménez, but they do not accept credit cards
Jinghpaw: Puerto Jimenez a Ranger kaw na kalang ta aup hkang na matu mai byin ai, raitim shanhte credit card hpe nhkap la ai.

English: The Park Service (MINAE) does not issue park permits more than one month in advance of anticipated arrival.
Jinghpaw: The Park Service (MINAE) hpung gaw nampan tsun galaw ahkang lakmat hpe shata langai hta jan nna tau hkrau mai lu na ngu ai hpe ntsun shapraw da ai.

English: CafeNet El Sol offers a reservation service for a fee of US$30, or $10 for one-day passes; details on their Corcovado page.
Jinghpaw: Cafenet El Sol gaw alak myi lajang da ai lam hpe manu hpu US$30 hte galaw ya ai lam jaw nga ai re, ahkri ahkrai ni hpe gaw shanhte a Corcovado online laika man kaw re.

English: The Cook Islands are an island country in free association with New Zealand, located in Polynesia, in the middle of the South Pacific Ocean.
Jinghpaw: Cook Islands ngu ai zunlawng mungdan gaw Dingda Pacific nammuk dara a ka'ang na, Polynesia ngu ai shara kaw nga ai, New Zealand mungdan hte kanawn mazum lam, matut mahkai lam nga ai mungdan langai rai nga ai.

English: It is an archipelago with 15 islands spread out over 2.2 million km2 of ocean.
Jinghpaw: Dai shara gaw panglai ga 15 daram hte 2.2 million km2 daram nga ai re.

English: With the same time zone as Hawaii, the islands are sometimes thought of as "Hawaii down under".
Jinghpaw: Hawaii hte aten bung nna, zunlawng ni gaw kalang marang "Hawaii kata kaw sha re kun" ngu nna shadu ma ai.

English: Though smaller, it reminds some elderly visitors of Hawaii before statehood without all the large tourist hotels and other development.
Jinghpaw: Hawaii gaw manam jarik kaba ni, kaga bawngring lam ni nnga shi ai ten mungdaw mungdan hku nre shi ai sha naw kaji nga ai shaloi kaw na mying kaba ai manam ni sa du ga ai hpe myit dum shangun ai.

English: The Cook Islands do not have any cities but are composed of 15 different islands. The main ones are Rarotonga and Aitutaki.
Jinghpaw: The Cook Zunlawng ni hta mare kaba ngu ai hku nnga ai raitim nbung ai zunlawng 15 hte gahkyin da ai re. Madung zunlawng ni gaw Rarotonga hte Aitutaki re.

English: In developed countries today, providing deluxe bed and breakfasts has been raised to a sort of art-form.
Jinghpaw: Dai ni rawt jat sai mungdan ni kaw gaw, zinghkam yupra hte manap lu sha ni hpe gaw shingni hpan langai hku gaw sharawt wa sai re.

English: At the top end, B&Bs obviously compete mainly on two main things: bedding and breakfast.
Jinghpaw: Madang tsaw dik ai hta, B&B ni gaw madung hku na lam lahkawng hta sha shing jawng sai: yup ra hte jahpawt shat.

English: Accordingly, at the finest such establishments one is apt to find the most luxurious bedding, maybe a handmade quilt or an antique bed.
Jinghpaw: Dai zawn grai kaja ai langai hpe galaw wa ai hta grai manu ai yup bra, lada hte galaw da ai dai nrai manu dan ai yup bra hpe apt mu na matu re.

English: Breakfast may include seasonal delights of the region or the host's speciality dish.
Jinghpaw: Manap lusha hta gaw grupyin shara kaw na du hkra hte htuk ai mu hpa lusha ni (sh) manam madu a laksan shat mai ni lawm mai nga ai.

English: The setting might be an historic old building with antique furnishings, manicured grounds and a swimming pool.
